head.supplied: 15/11/69 ¶ ¶ I congratulate you, dear Mr Goyder, on your safe return from Arnhem's Land and on the successful completion of your surveys there. Pray be so kind to arrange that a full set of the plant...

div.p: GRG 35/2, no. 69/911, inwards correspondence, Department of Lands, State Records, Adelaide.

p.style: font-family: Geneva, Geneva; font-size: 12pt; text-align: end;

div.p:
I congratulate you, dear Mr Goyder, on your safe return from Arnhem's Land and on the successful completion of your surveys there. Pray be so kind to arrange that a full set of the plants & seeds &c, collected by Mr Schultz, will be forwarded to my establishment for examination. I could then furnish a brief report thereon. I have written officially on this subject also to the Director of the bot. Garden of Adelaide.
See M to R. Schomburgk, 15 November 1869.

p.style: font-family: Geneva, Geneva; font-size: 12pt; margin-left: 1.75in; margin-right: 0in; text-indent: 0in;
font-family: Geneva, Geneva; font-size: 12pt; margin-left: 1.75in; margin-right: 0in; text-indent: 0in;

div.p:
Ferd von Mueller
MS annotations: 'Ackge [Acknowledge] with thanks & say Dr Müller may rely upon my doing all in my power to further his [views] — when the specimens have been unpacked [illegible initials] 19.11.69'; and 'Forwarded to Cr. Lds. [Crown Lands] office for reference to Dr Schomburgk — who has kindly consented to see that such plants &c as can be spared are forwarded to Dr Müller at Melbourne. [same illegible initials] 20.11.69'.
MS annotation in a different hand: 'Dr Schomburgk has informed me of a letter being sent by today's steamer, assuring Dr Muller that he will participate in the distribution about to take place. Returned to the Suvr. Genl. By authority [illegible signature] [Sec C Ld.] 23/11/69'.
